reviews.text: The Rochari experience is perfect from the first moment to the last. Everything works smooth as silk, without disturbing but trying to do, everyone, their best to make your stay unforgettable. The hotel is nice, very Mykonos in fact: white washed and with blue windows and doors. The swimming pool is great all day and perfect at sunset, as is the terrace and Zanos, the bartender.
reviews.title: Soooooo nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saying it is clean is not fair: like in a five stars hotel, it seems they are waiting for you to leave the room to fix it, make your beds or change your towels.
reviews.title: a bit sceptical before our visit but loved this hotel and its location

likes.liked: — The friendly mixture of staff and guests, very nice bedroom and fantastic views of the town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking after traditional luxury don´t go there but, if you are looking for the real one: being treated like a friend from the moment zero, enjoying the island in a nice place, - comfortable and near to everything - and getting real value for the money, don’t think in staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Trip Advisor reviews to choose Rochari Hotel for our honeymoon last August. It feels like ages since we stayed there and we have taken some time to register and post a review. The hotel deserves it though.
reviews.title: Rochari was our favorite hotel in Greece!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was sceptical about so many good reviews but my wife liked the website and what it showed us and the fact it was a few minutes walk down into the town, so we went ahead and booked.
reviews.title: Best in Mykonos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels on Mykonos, as far as we saw. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was very clean and the views where terrific! There is a back door to walk into Mykonos Town (about 5 minutes walk to the waterfront). Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews here are accurate. We used them to choose this place.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

likes.liked: — The views and the friendly staff
likes.disliked: — sometimes slow bar service in the evening

reviews.text: Very nice small hotel with fantastic views over the town. Usual size bedrooms, with fridge, air-conditioning, safety deposit, and TV. Our room was very clean and had a balcony with a great outlook.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!!

likes.disliked: — Hard beds (thats the way it is in Greece)

reviews.text: Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Nice bar and outdoor terrace area where you can eat/drink and savour the view. Thanks to Georgia at the bar daytime, who served us breakfast and sometimes lunch in such a pleasant and courteous manner.
reviews.title: So nice to be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was great but busy. Needed to get down there early to find a vacant sunbed.
reviews.title: A little gem!

reviews.text: A bunch of us booked the Rochari on the trusted advice of friends with whom I had previously stayed twice at The Belvedere which is next door but one and still my favourite hotel on the island.
reviews.title: Disappointing! But I'm fussy...

likes.liked: — Location and view from private terrace
